params.accountKeyCommit: The hash of the account key, email address and relayer randomness
params.emailAddrPointer: The hash of the relayer randomness and email address
params.psiPoint: The psi point of the email address
params.relayerHash: The hash of the relayer randomness
params.walletSalt: The hash of the account key and 01

verifyAccountInitializaionProof(string,b.details: `accountKeyCommit`, `dkimPublicKeyHash` should be the values previously stored in the contract

params.accountKeyCommit: The hash of the account key, email address and relayer randomness
params.dkimPublicKeyHash: The hash of the DKIM public key of `emailDomain`
params.emailAddrPointer: The hash of the relayer randomness and email address
params.emailDomain: The domain of the user's email address
params.emailNullifier: The nullifier computed for the reply email
params.proof: Proof of email with above constraints
params.relayerHash: The hash of the relayer randomness

params.dkimPublicKeyHash: The hash of the DKIM public key of `emailDomain`
params.emailDomain: The domain of the user's email address
params.emailNullifier: The nullifier computed for the email
params.oldAccountKeyCommit: The hash of the account key, email address and old relayer randomness
params.oldRelayerRandHash: The hash of the old relayer randomness
params.proof: Proof of email with above constraints

params.recipientEmailAddrCommit: The hash(emailAddress, randomness) where randomness was set by sender and passed to recipient relayer
params.recipientEmailAddrPointer: The hash of the relayer randomness and recipient email address
params.recipientRelayerHash: The hash of the relayer randomness

verifyEmailOpProof(string,bytes32,uint25.details: `relayerHash`, `emailAddrPointer`, `dkimPublicKeyHash` should be the values previously stored in the contract

params.dkimPublicKeyHash: The hash of the DKIM public key of `emailDomain`
params.emailAddrPointer: The hash of the relayer randomness and users's email address
params.emailDomain: The domain of the user's email address
params.emailNullifier: The nullifier computed for the email
params.hasEmailRecipient: Whether the email subject has a recipient (email address)
params.maskedSubject: The subject of the email with (any) email address masked
params.recipientEmailAddrCommit: The hash of recipeint's email address (from subject) and a randomness
params.relayerHash: The hash of the relayer randomness

verifyAccountCreationProof(bytes32,bytes.notice: Verify the proof to create an accountVerify `emailAddrPointer`, `accountKeyCommit` and `walletSalt`         are calculated from the same `emailAddress`, `accountKey` and `relayerRandomness`

verifyAccountInitializaionProof(string,b.notice: Verify the proof to initialize an account (reply to the invitation email)This verify the relayer received an email from the user (with corresponding `emailAddrPointer`)         where `accountKey` (of corresponding `accountKeyCommit`) was used in `x-reply-to` header

verifyAccountTransportProof(string,bytes.notice: Verify the proof to transport account from one relayer to anotherThis will verify that relayer received an email from user with their account key somewhere in header         and the email is DKIM signed by the public key of `emailDomain` whose hash is `dkimPublicKeyHash`.         Also proved that the accountKeyCommit of old relayer with hash `oldRelayerRandHash` is same as `oldAccountKeyCommit`

verifyClaimFundProof(bytes32,bytes32,byt.notice: Verify the proof to claim and unclaimed to a recipient accountThis verify that same email address is used in `recipientEmailAddrPointer` and `recipientEmailAddrCommit`

verifyEmailOpProof(string,bytes32,uint25.notice: Verify the proof of email from user - used to verify EmailOpVerify that relayer received an email where:         sender's email address domain is `emailDomain`,         sender's email address and relayer randmness derives `emailAddrPointer`,         is DKIM signed by public key whose hash is `dkimPublicKeyHash`,         the subject is same as `maskedSubject` with email address masked (if any),         and email address in subject is used to derive `recipientEmailAddrCommit`
